TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SessionParameter extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter

Docs.summary: Binds the value of a session variable to a parameter object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A `SessionParameter` object is typically used in order to include the value of an <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState> variable in the `Where` clause of a database query. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property identifies the session variable from which the SessionParameter retrieves a value.
> [!NOTE] > Controls that bind data to a parameter by using a SessionParameter object might throw an exception if the specified session variable is not set. To avoid this error (where appropriate), set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use a SessionParameter object. The example assumes that another page has stored an employee ID value in a session variable named `empid`. The example page uses the `empid` session variable in the `Where` clause of a query and displays the result of the query in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property of the SessionParameter object is set to 5, data for the record that has the `employeeID` value of 5 will still be displayed if no session variable named `empid` is set before you run the example.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_317_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_317_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new unnamed instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object created with the SessionParameter constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>. Additionally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection?displayProperty=fullName>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a default instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> class with the SessionParameter constructor.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_180_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_180_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter original) cil managed

Docs.param: A from which the current instance is initialized.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the values of the instance specified by the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SessionParameter constructor is a `Protected` copy constructor used to clone a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> instance. The values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object, including the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> properties, are all transferred to the new instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string sessionField) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the name/value pair that the parameter object is bound to. The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new named instance of the class, using the specified string to identify which session state name/value pair to bind to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> properties are initialized with default values.

MemberSignature.Value: public SessionParameter (string name, System.Data.DbType dbType, string sessionField);

Docs.param: The database type that the parameter represents.
The name of the name/value pair that the parameter object is bound to. The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, by using the specified name and type, and binding the parameter to the specified session state name/value pair. This constructor is for database types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are initialized with default values.

The name of the name/value pair that the parameter object is bound to. The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new named and strongly typed instance of the class, using the specified string to identify which session state name/value pair to bind to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the SessionParameter constructor to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object and use it with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control to display data in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_3#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ad2d7cbb-19a8-4a2f-8790-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_3#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ad2d7cbb-19a8-4a2f-8790-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a duplicate of the current instance.
Docs.returns: A that is an exact duplicate of the current one.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Clone method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter%29> copy constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> class with the values of the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override object Evaluate (System.Web.HttpContext context, System.Web.UI.Control control);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance object Evaluate(class System.Web.HttpContext context, class System.Web.UI.Control control) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is associated with the Web Forms page where the is used.
Docs.summary: Updates and returns the value of the object.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the updated and current value of the parameter. If the context or the request is , the Evaluate method returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object attempts to bind to the value of the session variable every time the Evaluate method is called.
The `context` parameter is used by the Evaluate method to retrieve the name/value pair that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object binds to. The `control` parameter is ignored.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the session variable that the parameter binds to.
Docs.value: A string that identifies the that the parameter binds to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SessionField property identifies a name/value pair that is stored in the current session object associated with the Web browser. While the SessionField property identifies the name of the pair, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> binds to its corresponding value at run time. If the expected session string name/value pair is not found in the session, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method binds the parameter to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property, if it is set. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method fails to bind the parameter to a value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to declaratively create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object, set its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, SessionField and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> properties, and add it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.SelectParameters%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control displays the results of the SQL query submitted by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_161_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_161_1.aspx)]
The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically set the SessionField property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object.
